intro: Euphorbia frickiana, commonly known as the Frick's spurge, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, ribbed stems and small, clustered flowers that range from yellow to orange in color. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is known for its ability to store water in its thick leaves and stems, allowing it to thrive in arid environments. It produces a milky sap that can be irritating to the skin, a common trait among many species in the Euphorbiaceae family. Euphorbia frickiana is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and adaptability to dry conditions.
